WorkItem.Description: I really would love to see a support effort for mono runtime and its really simple by removing the P/Invokes that are used in "CreateGdiFontImage" and in "GetInfos" methods

Comments.Message:
I would really like to see this so decided to take a look at this... has anyone else tried this?  

It looks like this section of the code gets a data array of the font from the GDI+ library, and so requires user32.dll.  It seems it might be possible to get around this by:

1 - Only using built in fonts (I think itextsharp does this).
2 - Embedding the ttf files in the program and accessing them directly (I think ttf is true type font)
3-  something else.

Does this seem about what might be needed?  Was going to look more but I don't know this code at all so wanted to see if other ideas were out there.
Looks like there is a XPrivateFontCollection class that would be very useful here, but isn't quite implemented yet
